item.title: Police arrests 20 suspects for distributing child sexual abuse content
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Law enforcement authorities from over a dozen countries have arrested 20 suspects in an international operation targeting the production and distribution of child sexual abuse material. [...]

item.title: Google’s upcoming Gemini Kingfall is allegedly a coding beast
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google's AI advancement is not slowing down, and we might be getting yet another powerful model codenamed "Gemini Kingfall." [...]

item.title: ChatGPT prepares o3-pro model for $200 Pro subscribers
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is planning to ship an update to ChatGPT that will turn on the new o3 Pro model, which has more compute to think harder. [...]

item.title: FBI: BADBOX 2.0 Android malware infects millions of consumer devices
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: The FBI is warning that the BADBOX 2.0 malware campaign has infected over 1 million home Internet-connected devices, converting consumer electronics into residential proxies that are used for malicious activity. [...]

item.title: Old AT&T data leak repackaged to link SSNs, DOBs to 49M phone numbers
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A threat actor has re-released data from a 2021 AT&T breach affecting 70 million customers, this time combining previously separate files to directly link Social Security numbers and birth dates to individual users. [...]

item.title: Hacker selling critical Roundcube webmail exploit as tech info disclosed
item.dc:creator: Ionut Ilascu
item.description: Hackers are actively exploiting CVE-2025-49113, a critical vulnerability in the widely used Roundcube open-source webmail application that allows remote execution. [...]

item.title: Designing a Windows Service for Security
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by ThreatLocker
item.description: Designing a security-focused Windows Service? Learn more from ThreatLocker about the core components for real-time monitoring, threat detection, and system hardening to defend against malware and ransomware. [...]

item.title: Germany fines Vodafone $51 million for privacy, security breaches
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The German data protection authority (BfDI) has fined Vodafone GmbH, the telecommunications company's German subsidiary, €45 million ($51.4 million) for privacy and security violations. [...]

item.title: ViLE gang members sentenced for DEA portal breach, extortion
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Two members of a group of cybercriminals named ViLE were sentenced this week for hacking into a federal law enforcement web portal in an extortion scheme. [...]

item.title: Interlock ransomware claims Kettering Health breach, leaks stolen data
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The Interlock ransomware gang has claimed a recent cyberattack on the Kettering Health healthcare network and leaked data allegedly stolen from breached systems. [...]

item.title: US offers $10M for tips on state hackers tied to RedLine malware
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The U.S. Department of State has announced a reward of up to $10 million for any information on government-sponsored hackers with ties to the RedLine infostealer malware operation and its suspected creator, Russian national Maxim Alexandrovich Rudometov. [...]

item.title: Microsoft unveils free EU cybersecurity program for governments
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Microsoft announced in Berlin today a new European Security Program that promises to bolster cybersecurity for European governments. [...]
